climbs.name: Lilygren-Lightner
climbs.fa: Mike Lilygren and Sam Lightner, June 2, 2019

content.description: Climb 4th class up the west face to a 5.7 move into the notch. You can get a cam, like a 2.5 or so, under the big block (seems semi solid). Build a belay in a soft crack  and on a good ledge on the south face and bring up your pal. Pitch 2 goes up the rotten ramp and clips a bolt, then step across and work up the wall on less than desireable rock (crux). Four feet from the summit you get in a 3.5. Saddle onto the summit and belay. The anchor is in the more-solid rock just below the summit on the north face. Committing getting down to it.
content.protection: Single set of cams, 70 meter rope, experience.
content.location: North side of Lost Immigrant Spire West, then south side.

climbs.name: Lightner-Lilygren
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner and Mike Lilygren, June 2, 2019

content.description: Find the obvious chimney on the north side where the giant block rests against the main spire. Choss-upward into the actual squeeze chimney  at about 70 feet (crux). Exit onto the ledge and step across to the summit knob. The summit is rotten so the anchor is just below it on the north face. You get one piece of gear, like a #3 -#3.5 friend, just before the step across move, but it doesn't do you much good. BTW, the above star rating is based on location and a love of adventure, not rock quality.
content.protection: Single rack of friends so you feel like you are climbing. One 70 ft. rope. Knowledge.
content.location: It's in the desert.... we went over this.
